## Instructions

Run the task-work skill in loop mode:

```
/task-work loop
```

Loop mode means: no confirmations, auto-resolve decisions, automation-eligible tasks only.

Exit when task work is complete or no eligible tasks remain.

availableCommands.name: keybindings-help
availableCommands.description: Use when the user wants to customize keyboard shortcuts, rebind keys, add chord bindings, or modify ~/.claude/keybindings.json. Examples: "rebind ctrl+s", "add a chord shortcut", "change the submit key", "customize keybindings". (bundled)

availableCommands.name: kspec
availableCommands.description: Use kspec CLI for task and spec management. Invoke when working with tasks, tracking work, capturing ideas, checking session status, or managing specs in this project. (project)

availableCommands.name: local-review
availableCommands.description: Pre-PR quality review - verify AC coverage, test quality, and test isolation. (project)

availableCommands.name: meta
availableCommands.description: Manage session context - focus, threads, questions, and observations. Use when tracking what you're working on, managing parallel work streams, or capturing friction points. (project)

availableCommands.name: pr
availableCommands.description: Create a pull request from current work. Handles branch creation, commits, push, and PR creation. (project)

availableCommands.name: pr-review
availableCommands.description: Review and merge a PR with quality gates. Verifies AC coverage and spec alignment before merge. Used in subagent context. (project)

availableCommands.name: reflect
availableCommands.description: Reflect on a session to identify learnings, friction points, and improvements. Captures valuable insights for future sessions. (project)

availableCommands.name: spec
availableCommands.description: Specification management - creating, organizing, and maintaining spec items with acceptance criteria and traits. (project)

availableCommands.name: spec-plan
availableCommands.description: Translate an approved plan into specs with acceptance criteria and derived tasks. Use after plan mode when transitioning to implementation. (project)

availableCommands.name: task-work
availableCommands.description: Work on a kspec task with proper lifecycle - verify, start, note, submit, PR, complete. (project)

availableCommands.name: triage
availableCommands.description: Triage inbox items systematically. Analyzes items against spec/tasks, categorizes them, and processes using spec-first approach. (project)

availableCommands.name: compact
availableCommands.description: Clear conversation history but keep a summary in context. Optional: /compact [instructions for summarization]

availableCommands.name: init
availableCommands.description: Initialize a new CLAUDE.md file with codebase documentation

availableCommands.name: pr-comments
availableCommands.description: Get comments from a GitHub pull request

availableCommands.name: security-review
availableCommands.description: Complete a security review of the pending changes on the current branch

toolResponse.stdout:
Capture Agent Stderr for Usage Parsing
────────────────────────────────────────
ULID:      01KG8G1318V7WSE74WVFRJJ6FZ
Slugs:     task-capture-stderr
Type:      task
Status:    pending
Priority:  1
Automation: eligible
Spec ref:  @mem-context-usage
Created:   2026-01-30T22:22:54.504Z

─── Spec Context ───
Context Usage Tracking
Type: feature
Description:
  Track context usage via /usage command with stderr parsing. Provides token counts to SessionLifecycleManager for rotation decisions.
Acceptance Criteria:
  [ac-1]
    Given: Agent process spawned
    When: Process writes to stderr
    Then: Stderr output is captured programmatically (not inherited to parent)
  [ac-2]
    Given: Agent response completes
    When: Usage check triggered
    Then: /usage command sent to agent and response awaited
  [ac-3]
    Given: /usage response captured from stderr
    When: Parsing completes
    Then: ContextUsageUpdate emitted with model, token counts, and category breakdown
  [ac-4]
    Given: /usage command fails or times out
    When: Error caught
    Then: Session continues with stale usage data; warning logged

─── Notes ───
[2026-01-30T22:23:07.839Z] @claude:
## Implementation Details

**File**: packages/agent/src/lifecycle.ts

**Current State**:
- Line ~359: stdio: ['pipe', 'pipe', 'inherit'] - stderr goes to parent, not captured

**Implementation**:
1. Change stdio to ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe'] to capture stderr
2. Add stderr event handler on spawned process:
   ```typescript
   if (proc.stderr) {
     proc.stderr.on('data', (chunk: Buffer) => {
       this.emit('stderr', chunk.toString());
     });
   }
   ```
3. Add onStderr(callback) method to AgentLifecycle for consumers
4. Buffer stderr output and emit structured events

**Acceptance Test**:
- Spawn agent, send /usage command, verify stderr content is captured programmatically
[2026-01-30T22:35:23.781Z] @claude:
Automation status set to needs_review: Task shares parent spec @mem-session-lifecycle ACs but only implements AC-5/AC-6/AC-7 subset (stderr capture + usage parsing). Consider breaking out a child spec for stderr capture or document which ACs apply.
[2026-01-30T22:49:07.389Z] @claude:
Spec updated: references @mem-context-usage AC-1 (stderr capture infrastructure)

─── Inherited from @trait-observable ───
  [ac-1] (from @trait-observable)
    Given: state change
    When: occurred
    Then: emits structured event
  [ac-2] (from @trait-observable)
    Given: error
    When: caught
    Then: logs with context and severity
  [ac-3] (from @trait-observable)
    Given: operation complete
    When: significant
    Then: emits completion event

--- Spec Context ---
Implementing: Context Usage Tracking

Track context usage via /usage command with stderr parsing. Provides token counts to SessionLifecycleManager for rotation decisions.

Acceptance Criteria (4):
  [ac-1]
    Given: Agent process spawned
    When: Process writes to stderr
    Then: Stderr output is captured programmatically (not inherited to parent)
  [ac-2]
    Given: Agent response completes
    When: Usage check triggered
    Then: /usage command sent to agent and response awaited
  [ac-3]
    Given: /usage response captured from stderr
    When: Parsing completes
    Then: ContextUsageUpdate emitted with model, token counts, and category breakdown
  [ac-4]
    Given: /usage command fails or times out
    When: Error caught
    Then: Session continues with stale usage data; warning logged

Remember: Add test coverage for each AC and mark tests with // AC: @spec-ref ac-N

rawInput.command:
kspec task note @task-capture-stderr "Implemented stderr capture in AgentLifecycle:

1. Changed stdio config from ['pipe', 'pipe', 'inherit'] to ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe'] to capture stderr programmatically instead of inheriting to parent
2. Added stderr event handler that emits 'stderr' events when process writes to stderr
3. Added onStderr(callback) convenience method for consumers to subscribe/unsubscribe from stderr events
4. Added 5 tests for AC-1 coverage:
   - should emit stderr events when process writes to stderr
   - should emit multiple stderr chunks as separate events
   - should provide onStderr convenience method for subscribing
   - should handle binary data converted to string
   - should not inherit stderr to parent process

All tests (973) pass. This provides the infrastructure needed for AC-2/AC-3/AC-4 (usage parsing) in the next task."

feat(agent): capture stderr output from agent process

Change stdio configuration from 'inherit' to 'pipe' for stderr, enabling
programmatic capture of agent process stderr output. This provides the
infrastructure needed for parsing /usage command output for context usage
tracking.

Changes:
- Changed stdio from ['pipe', 'pipe', 'inherit'] to ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe']
- Added stderr data event handler that emits 'stderr' events
- Added onStderr(callback) convenience method for subscribing to stderr
- Updated mock process in tests to include stderr stream
- Added 5 tests for AC-1 coverage

Task: @task-capture-stderr
Spec: @mem-context-usage

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

rawInput.command:
gh pr create --title "feat(agent): capture stderr output from agent process" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- Changed stdio configuration from `['pipe', 'pipe', 'inherit']` to `['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe']` to capture stderr programmatically instead of inheriting to parent process
- Added stderr data event handler that emits `'stderr'` events when the agent process writes to stderr
- Added `onStderr(callback)` convenience method for consumers to subscribe/unsubscribe from stderr events
- This provides the infrastructure needed for AC-2/AC-3/AC-4 (usage parsing from `/usage` command output)

## Test plan

- [x] Verify stderr events are emitted when process writes to stderr
- [x] Verify multiple stderr chunks emit as separate events  
- [x] Verify `onStderr` convenience method works with subscribe/unsubscribe
- [x] Verify binary data is converted to string correctly
- [x] Verify spawn is called with `stdio: ['pipe', 'pipe', 'pipe']`
- [x] All 973 tests pass

Task: @task-capture-stderr
Spec: @mem-context-usage

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"
